5D7AEBB813254FF5A9A9E87DE8838BA8.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

82C367A1824B4878A94263CDE05A1994.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

C38B1E49A94042618FFA990E86E10B9E.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

D2F4C62862534584B2D0CFCDC39CD1A8.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

98BC96E780994C9F93CF258003A0064E.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

A5BF24F1991648DCA3506FD4A42B6355.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

283A5B7D1ECB41C1A4E7EEE578EAB8A6.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

3A82633CE4A348CFA98B6099C9434D4F.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

6790F0E5C99E45DAA468BB6C196F4B8C.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

4A77616626804EEF90F5AB9ECDA31D60.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

F2564829B09D4DBE867F97DADC135705.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

0CCBAE323BA4412C92A9F348A77F8D21.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

2CE51C7D52224B5E8DB6F1EA05DC6D16.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

D913B3C1F851401492D823562005C84B.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?,  Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

2280F65F75684C4F8CC2330C256B35D5.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

9045855727B641DD838C4A3A10D1E236.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

01C1B2969B5642618176BB0F5C5EC597.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

21DE1A046ACB472F9B2B42C5336FF7B9.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

2BBE3DF8955C45FE853233B66A479690.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

C27DA4D576EB43D79EAC6E6B23F8CC83.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

8A7755E2A8524C77AD4509FBB3FC7B32.description: Reflect on personal contributions to, and personal growth resulting from, developing, implementing, managing and evaluating the marketing campaign.

8BEA71F2B884481C94FC7090C07454CD.description: Conclude and evaluate the success of the marketing campaign based upon the criteria outlined in the marketing plan.

1CF54242BDAE45E086C78937D5B8558D.description: Monitor the implementation of the marketing plan and make adjustments, as required, throughout the process.

1D41A3A2EBFA4E96B60D957CEFD271C5.description: Collaborate with the chosen company or organization to develop a marketing plan.

994105A08D45472094CC91A19DA07772.description: Analyze marketing strategies used by companies and organizations that are considered competitors.

27AAA6DCBCD0444689B35E98E90F6223.description: Assess the pros and cons of the various companies and organizations researched to determine the best option(s) for a project.

9CDE55500BC64D1E8EC08732174D94EF.description: Research companies and organizations (e.g., local businesses, not-forprofits and school or community clubs and teams) as potential clients or beneficiaries for a marketing campaign.

9EEB218A08444248A665599F91417701.description: Develop, implement, manage and evaluate the success of a marketing campaign.

9C392D32BF1F47C1A4662DD576211365.description: Develop a commercial or social marketing plan with a budgetary limit.

23211AF8F44E40999C3FE902F1C8BE57.description: Identify reasons for changing or recalibrating a marketing plan.

010B004B9A3C4D1E854B5B288EDAB599.description: Describe the elements of prepared marketing plans, such as: • market analysis (e.g., purpose and mission of the business or organization; description of current markets and strategies; primary competitors; and SWOT [i.e., strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats] analysis);  marketing strategy (e.g., goals and expected outcomes, target market description, marketing mix); and, implementation (e.g., activity schedule including responsibilities, schedule and budget; evaluation procedures including evidence of success and methods of collecting the evidence).

565E70EEBD9342A382007195FEE81249.description: Analyze the impact of finances on a marketing plan

F8B9AF7199BF4BF8A6D430EBEF52A564.description: Assess characteristics (e.g., organized, easy to read, clear section headings and free of grammar or spelling errors) of prepared strategic marketing plans.

55839984EF9A4D589894392CD0D2190D.description: Describe the purpose of a marketing plan

B3A981CFB30442AD8AA3248C62FEEBDB.description: Research tenets of an effective marketing campaign such as consistency (e.g., of message, brand, tone and relevancy), frequency (e.g., of message; less effective advertisements require more frequency) and creativity (e.g., amusing; engaging; and featuring well-designed imagery, video or text).

5BA11C761D6B4BCBBC9A4EAA8155CDDE.description: Discuss the importance and interrelatedness of the marketing mix (i.e., traditional or extended) for strategic marketing.

5EE898DF004343289659C50C5C5C2868.description: Examine the relationship between a value proposition and strategic marketing.

1F7C694281D742F489B44BD61E106685.description: Identify examples of value propositions presented by several brands.

CAAFB4243BA143E59BF6938F2CF1D900.description: Examine characteristics and components of a strategic marketing plan.

C700B7BD9819457EB561EA52F4EEDD2F.description: Reflect on personal and collective responsibility for, and commitment to, developing and supporting a positive health and safety culture at work.

86ABC19855F24AA286CB60578281E00E.description: Develop a marketing campaign that promotes a positive health and safety culture in the marketing workplace.

BDB748FEBD824673A3B320452AD94207.description: Explain why some brands align themselves with safety messaging such as Mission Zero.

AEC18F9D93B04CE7BE5668FAA6031799.description: Compare the hazards associated with working remotely to working in an office environment.

7330424C590E44F39CFD97C669E5FEF7.description: Describe control measures, using the hierarchy of controls, to limit the risk of physical and mental health hazards associated with marketing work including: temperature (too hot or too cold);light (too much or not enough); workstation ergonomics; sitting for long periods; slips, trips and falls; repetitive strain and musculoskeletal disorders; stress (time pressures); anxiety (lack of perceived results); and, harassment or bullying.

8B9C62B06DD7408D9745DAACA0D80902.description: Explain the steps of the hierarchy of controls as a system to prevent hazards and reduce risk of injuries in the workplace, including: elimination – physically removing the hazard; • substitution – replacing the hazard; engineering controls – isolating people from the hazard; administrative controls – changing the way people work; and, personal protective equipment - protecting workers with the use of personal protective equipment

BE8D98D39FEB4F578977A7B723220A31.description: Research causes of stress and anxiety (e.g., little or no results from a marketing campaign and time pressures) for those working in marketing careers.

7ACC31E82BA445A98B6C9AFE9BBF8A3E.description: Identify potential physical hazards (e.g., exposure to allergens such as perfumes and other scents, sitting for long periods of time and eye strain) associated with office work.

96C82274FAB449CDA2A6ABDC9006FD41.description: Describe the importance and benefits of a positive health and safety culture at work.

406A6B607C6B4083951C208695BE3D10.description: Research: the meaning of due diligence and an employer’s responsibility to protect the health and safety of all workers; the legal requirements for health and safety programs in the workplace outlined in provincial legislation (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Regulations); the legal requirement for, and purpose of, an occupational health and safety (OHS) committee within the workplace; and the financial penalties for failing to comply with the Occupational Health and Safety Regulations.

82C222651FB048248E9504ACA9194CD5.description: Discuss the impact of a workplace injury on the injured and others including the employer, work colleagues, family and friends.

A1A06B6BE1AB4AD0B350365B0DB2C66C.description: Examine the benefits of a positive health and safety culture in the marketing workplace.

229280B814404C248F559822EEF61734.description: Health and Safety in the Marketing Workplace (Core)

5E01974D59F541D3BADEE6911532E1B0.description: Develop a personal plan that incorporates the four Ps (i.e., product, price, promotion and place) for marketing oneself to obtain employment in a position of personal interest, including: Product – oneself and the skills, experience and competencies one has to differentiate one’s personal brand; Price – the salary range one is seeking; Promotion – ways to communicate with potential employers; and, Place – where to interact or network with potential employers (e.g., online, networking and career fairs).

04BA47BFE2AD44B2999B7A6D1F876BB3.description: Reflect upon personal suitability or unsuitability for specific marketingrelated occupations considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational and training requirements; duties and skills required for the occupation; work environment, including typical hours and shift work and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to current wages in other regions of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to the occupation; workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact; certification requirements in Saskatchewan; and, • emerging and future trends in the industry.

E89EEB7ECDBE42F3AA965CC0FC227F2B.description: Research which marketing occupations are facing shortages and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally and/or provincially.

2DAF80E8391648528A0303109A39BB04.description: List personal interests, skills, abilities and traits that may lead to a career in marketing.

D56DFD40AD084885A0D12ACEDE0BA6C8.description: Generate a list of questions to ask a professional in the marketing industry to learn about their work; questions may include: What do you do? , What knowledge and skills do you use every day?, What does a typical day look like for you?, What is the most interesting marketing project you have worked on?

94310601E824405E8BCE73385A4F1B68.description: Examine the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities typically required by those who work in marketing

0CD934196035459A84D6D57ACD175459.description: Compare the marketing services offered by a variety of Saskatchewanbased marketing or advertising companies

AF1F77D106864F12B5C83207122E0CBC.description: Research opportunities and trends in marketing careers in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.

B5AC3EC6EDE94077B95B23F66F112A1B.description: Assess the role that marketers play in creating and supporting the ideal customer experience through customer experience marketing.

CFE2A28731D44CDCBCAF50866CA41D4A.description: Describe characteristics of ideal customer experiences.

6C0E18C1EDBA41BAB938E28493A6977D.description: Reflect on personal encounters with poor and exemplary customer experiences

302664E7F8FB4F9896C557F7071CCF37.description: Explore effective marketing strategies for connecting with consumers at each of the stages.

B223FF42F2D1438F85725B048A9A325E.description: Identify the stages (e.g., pre-purchase, purchase and post-purchase) of a customer journey map.

B8CD99D9A32840C798827198A291483E.description: Propose strategies for replying to both positive and negative online reviews.

FD979F064B7D4A46B9C0642485B318D3.description: Discuss the importance of monitoring, managing and responding to online and other reviews

0DB877B624CB4E83BE400F3C0DF5D27A.description: Examine the benefits (e.g., greater brand loyalty and improved customer retention) of such marketing efforts.

C51D8785C5D044FFAC3A73175936C5D9.description: Explain what customer-centric marketing means and the importance of a business or organization knowing and understanding its customers.

8C4B0BC1A5A54004ABE36FC51AD47BAE.description: Differentiate between customer service and customer experiences.

9B3D4460D76544498A94174F43324653.description: Examine the relationship between marketing and customer experiences.

F2367919482F4DA6A859D1B3FEC46FC8.description: Brainstorm examples (e.g., a dad making dinner or a mom fixing a lawn mower) of marketing that challenge stereotypes.

B43F72CA706440AF91C1A548DA9F076D.description: Justify stereotype marketing as an exclusive, rather than inclusive, marketing strategy.

D4171EDCBF594E3E8E1E00182525C6D8.description: Explain, and provide examples of, stereotype marketing.

02DCA46353724D05BF03E65640DC8D6A.description: Propose strategies for becoming familiar with and understanding a culture, such as: consulting with Elders, Knowledge Keepers or community leaders; participating in cultural experiences and events; experiencing media from other countries; and, visiting local museums and cultural centres.

D0FED7A1B7644825A7BF14188588522E.description: Examine the potential impact of using cultural appropriation and cultural appreciation in marketing campaigns.

CEBB96122D2744E2BDE44AD4DCDE0082.description: Differentiate between cultural appropriation and cultural appreciation.

D52708E8DD514B5E870D9B8BB734EA34.description: Discuss the importance of cultural understanding in developing effective and culturally sensitive marketing content.

7099B48797D548D7A0F3736021BB2117.description: Discuss the impact that inclusive marketing can have on a brand (e.g., creating loyalty and trust) and on others (e.g., giving voice to a marginalized group).

C143608DAA734BBE9F4F936F7A52E5C0.description: Research ways that marketing content can be more easily accessed by users of all abilities (e.g., audio or larger text for individuals with vision impairments, print for individuals with hearing impairments and digital content for individuals with motor impairments) or by users with limited access (e.g., print materials or television content for individuals with no or limited access to the Internet).

38156E811D0B46D3B9503F99891DCD34.description: Explain accessible marketing as a component of inclusive marketing.

EFF16EA34C2644F2BE96CBA7FF0D8914.description: Examine the importance of inclusive marketing.

853597C8F7394FC48D65F5CC0C73EADD.description: Research ways (e.g., Certified B Corporations) to verify a company’s claim of being socially responsible.

4C8C37F1460E4026B85C682A95D0E0D5.description: Analyze the impact of marketing strategies used by local, provincial (e.g., tentree), national (e.g., Manitobah Mukluks) and international (e.g., The Body Shop, Toms, and Proctor and Gamble—Dawn Soap) companies that promote themselves as being socially responsible.

ED4C41E549B04D2E83E22FAB309A12D5.description: Examine social responsibility and the benefits (e.g., to the business, consumer, society, the environment and others) of having a socially responsible marketing strategy

330157CD4929486D8C6D31C54E264361.description: Discuss the relationship among purpose-driven marketing, ethics and social responsibility

76BE58380FEC4CDC888A9F1C448A7A1E.description: Summarize the standards for marketing in Canada as detailed by the Canadian Marketing Association Code of Ethics and Standards.

56310E39208B43EB808844EA0C3EE7EB.description: Identify examples of types of false or misleading advertising such as bait and switch, price deception, unsubstantiated claims and misleading photos or illustrations

E5ED153933D14C2ABB81339F1BCF11E4.description: Describe the importance of ethical behaviour and business ethics as they relate to ethical marketing.

B0B526A718A14D268B1655074880709C.description: Research the evolution and resulting impact of privacy and consumer protection laws on marketing practices in Saskatchewan and Canada.

87881AE4529D4E5C92986116E4799A41.description: Assess the importance of regulations for both consumers and businesses.

9455B07FF4BB49A7941BA946C1CCF371.description: Describe good ethics in business as it relates to relationships between, but not limited to: businesses and customers; businesses and suppliers; and, employers and employees.

7927A6DF52D34437BC36BF4B5CCE38D8.description: Assess the importance of ethical and socially responsible behaviour and marketing.

E77452B6B52544A6A69C1889E331B3B7.description: Describe marketing strategies that would be effective with potential customers, including self, for a variety of products.

40658700C6464E11840B9EA3C979BAB1.description: Develop several buyer personas, including one for self.

1D4361589DC34D82BF364C84BC0C9365.description: Outline the steps for creating a buyer persona.

69F5DCAB740646809DAFE1B1F386E25F.description: Investigate how marketers use buyer personas to drive marketing success.

DC361872D2D8457D9EDBE34D1F56104D.description: Explore ways in which a market can be segmented, including: demographic (e.g., age, gender, income and occupation);  geographic (e.g., location such as postal code or region); behavioural (e.g., online shopping habits, actions taken on a website and loyalty); and, psychographic (e.g., interests, lifestyles and attitudes).

E01CFA747C3D4D20A57ED6A3695D7367.description: Describe what market segmentation is and why it is beneficial.

1D1A6D06BBAC458383A077F1EF5C296A.description: Explain the concept of a target market.

E515879DB04E466BABE540CF1D301464.description: Describe ways to confirm the credibility of sources of secondary data as well as the accuracy of that data.

5845CBFADE85488A84B5B116CAF550A2.description: Identify sources of secondary data such as: government departments, libraries, business incubators and chambers of commerce (public and generally free); trade associations and research firms (commercial and generally associated with subscription or association fees); and, colleges, universities, technical institutes (academic).

EF5DCC7F338A42A9B35E86A3EA7B5420.description: Discuss the advantages (e.g., less costly than primary research and easier/quicker to gather) and disadvantages (e.g., datedness and reason for collecting may not align with one’s purposes) of secondary research.

8E0CA73036F54302A7D6DBE6EBCD5728.description: Identify ways (e.g., observations and surveys such as pop-up or omnibus) in which primary data can be gathered.

00E7E3D7187343EA8801AA1E6801F772.description: Differentiate between primary and secondary market research.

CF8B5C76C59A41FE8A22E78C3D0AF6F9.description: Describe ways in which qualitative and quantitative research might be conducted and how the results might be used in marketing research.

55966CD32CA144D6B5F88D25669A7877.description: Examine the importance of identifying and monitoring the competition as part of initial and ongoing market research.

0F70DD1233764371808F8BCA9108CE8B.description: Explain the correlation between market research and the ability to make sound business or operational decisions.

BEC8DBA6F717449F900E960155E5B814.description: Discuss the purpose and importance of ongoing market research for effective and successful marketing

F15B32CE7CE7423D9503A8B35DD9C280.description: Assess the importance of market research for successful and effective marketing.

FFCAE37D462F48278886BB3F30B617B1.description: Develop a plan for promoting a business, brand or product of personal choice as an influencer marketer.

6BB133262E2E49E4BD060B4AD64B1185.description: Propose marketing strategies that may be effective to reach consumers of the future.

5C6B08317E854B9A80A20878F1D7FBD8.description: Conduct an inquiry into the process for becoming, and succeeding as, an influencer marketer.

94EA5727B63D4C9C966AF82BC2E58A0C.description: Investigate the origins, evolution and impact of influencer marketing to the present day.

F11502BDB6FE4BA59B17440B7F7D6E8E.description: Propose ways in which marketers can effectively deal with consumer advertising avoidance.

1749F7B733B047879770166434BF205E.description: Discuss actions (e.g., not sharing information, blocking pop-up advertisements on the computer and unsubscribing from newsletters) that consumers can take to avoid viewing or receiving advertising.

85BCC39834EE4A34AEBC2C57F4B639C7.description: Describe the concept of advertising avoidance.

745A6B7323A546DFB8B474EDCC38112E.description: Debate the ethics of tracking and leveraging consumer behaviour for marketing purposes.

1042F39EE93F4881AFBB47663F1508AC.description: Examine the types of consumer information that can be tracked through digital marketing.

4A7BC49412B34701AA0C2B9F87733A44.description: Identify ways that consumer behaviour (e.g., online or through SMS) can be tracked and leveraged for marketing purposes.

AA95957C6F9040EE91E3C14751DE589C.description: Defend the use of traditional, digital, or a hybrid of both types of marketing for a variety of given marketing scenarios.

7A7A409E17904BA0B694E9F067D43541.description: Examine the use and impact of animation and video in modern marketing.

9FD67B7509AB4C1D81EE087DE465DD23.description: Assess the impact on marketing strategies of limitations (e.g., blocking of cookies) imposed by digital platforms.

012B44F8ACF04F59A427A58F3C170473.description: Research how a variety of digital marketing models work, such as: content marketing; geofencing; search engine optimization; pay-per-click; social media marketing; and, email or SMS (i.e., short message service) marketing.

6F0F552A1CF844DCAC4A8DCB8DBF51E1.description: Examine the relationship between user behaviour (i.e., of the target audience) to the selection and application of traditional and/or digital marketing strategies

694B4A68B5854329B761307F847232A1.description: Assess advantages and disadvantages associated with traditional and digital marketing.

97A32B0586B74A71B2AD8B336FFFC24C.description: Relate traditional and digital marketing to the promotion “P” in the marketing mix

0FC6A9015C9845FE95F28A3EA3C0FA0A.description: Identify visible applications of traditional and digital marketing within the community.

92EF449C36D24498BB6FF3E99D5EC39D.description: Differentiate between traditional (e.g., print, television, direct mail and outdoor advertising such as signage) and digital marketing (i.e., online).

94E776EBCFE94630B13F04D95DB1CD20.description: Analyze the use of digital and traditional marketing strategies.

98AFD2C6B7EA43C697ECD0891FB3FB58.description: Examine the application of the extended marketing mix for a major global brand.

080D2C196EFE47E1BCC7FE3DF7E9A050.description: Identify examples (e.g., packaging, websites, and branding such as logos on employee uniforms and awards) associated with the physical evidence element of the extended marketing mix.

3CC90FBA10C94AAE9EE5B0CED1AEF1FA.description: Research desirable characteristics (e.g., efficiency, reliability and sustainability) of effective processes in the extended marketing mix

1E8FD33C8ADC4B62BFE199AD2976E56D.description: Explore the process element of the extended marketing mix.

7A0498E8F32E42AAAB911153017AAC6C.description: Reflect on personal or observed positive and negative people experiences as a customer.

2B05C25D105A494C8DF38033E0BA1072.description: Examine the role of brand voice in the people “P” of the extended marketing mix

FF21AE3EB86C4DA6B2BCEFE66D5BA5AB.description: Discuss desirable characteristics (e.g., effective and perceived positively by customers) associated with people roles in the extended marketing mix.

37F3DFA220D54854B7BCDC34FB477076.description: Describe various roles (e.g., salesperson, marketing team and customer service representative) that are considered part of the people element of the extended marketing mix

FDFD16E6A76441E8938FD0C2FF6B6114.description: Explain the reasons (e.g., easier to apply to services and the advent of online marketing and e-commerce) for the creation of the extended marketing mix.

0136138C9F8A460D8EAB9EC03596090D.description: Identify the three additional Ps (i.e., people, process and physical evidence) that have been added to the traditional marketing mix to create the extended marketing mix.

253AB398B821445CB1D41DE0336C16BF.description: Investigate components of the extended marketing mix.

6F8326BEA02D4908A25B72F317901B51.description: Examine the application of the 4 Ps for a business, organization or brand/product of personal interest.

45E83C704B04447695C9A9E6F2FC3ACE.description: Investigate advantages (e.g., global reach, cost efficiency and measurable results) and disadvantages (e.g., security and privacy issues, timeconsuming, and skills and training required) of online promotion.

76C23B76C0504BE8891BDA44B3633F98.description: Research considerations for product promotion such as: budget; how competitors promote their product; timing (e.g., time of day, week, month or season); and, infrastructure required for using marketing tools such as social media.

A7AB17BE379E47F6826E5C51D7AE4FFB.description: Identify real-life examples of push and pull marketing.

E60706EAB9C441499101F869DFCD4301.description: Compare features of push and pull marketing.

425D46F9EFD04C07B706AFF5C5F4566E.description: Identify paid (e.g., radio or television advertisements, print media and social advertisements) and free (e.g., organic social media and word of mouth) promotional opportunities.

62DCA21F499049EFA19D4AAECB82F803.description: Examine the role of promotion in gaining the attention of consumers and motivating them to take action (e.g., purchase a product or change behaviour).

BE874C9CB6BE48509C81C86DADB709A9.description: Research considerations for product placement, such as: where potential customers are located; where and how potential customers shop (e.g., retail location and online); and, where the competition places their products

C868ED5D3E0045E2A00505AB2743294F.description: Discuss the importance of offering a product in the right place and at the right time.

BC009CD22E694C82A3181011849007B2.description: Research considerations for pricing a product, such as: • the value, perceived or real, of high-end versus low-end brands; brand equity; the price customers are willing to pay; cost of production (e.g., materials and human resources); and, competitor pricing.

3010DFC760D04C669CF93AD0EDD85465.description: Assess the effects of pricing a product too high or pricing it too low

F253875C224F4CE69D4A20FC30F8D9E4.description: Research considerations for the product component of the traditional marketing mix, such as: the want or need it addresses; how the product differs from the competition; warranties and guarantees; and, packaging and labelling.

25D3E36399824ACB98CC5D5AC38D8655.description: Assess the importance of offering a product that meets or exceeds customer expectations

A1A1A6150E894249B372D17332E87369.description: Discuss reasons (e.g., meeting a basic need or contributing to a desired lifestyle) why customers purchase a particular product.

1580104CB3E14055A7685AF3E4F3C345.description: Categorize local businesses or organizations according to the types of products they offer

3A2ADF4FAB944DCB928D4613430694D4.description: Differentiate between products that are tangible (e.g., goods) and intangible (e.g., services, ideas or experiences).

218F04EEC6034B69B61581200C07BF02.description: Explain the application of the traditional marketing mix to a social marketing campaign.

46FFDF04390C4DBD833993E127E3A75D.description: Reflect on one’s personal brand including brand identity, image and voice.

6D242294F16541B08137BA8322D6C463.description: Explore the components (e.g., who one is, what one stands for, the values one embraces and the ways in which one expresses those values) of a personal brand.

CDF71ADD9B5B480BB33F89B989C5F0E7.description: Reflect on ways that consumer behaviour can affect individuals as well as others in all aspects of life (e.g., at home, at work, at play and at school).

47C9B1DBB5154DDFB0EA38B911D3BAC1.description: Identify examples of referral marketing (e.g., Uber share codes or refer a friend promotions).

B584652E879B4422AAB571E557349ABE.description: Examine factors that influence consumer buying behaviour including: situational (e.g., reason for making a purchase; social surroundings such as others present at the time of purchase; physical surroundings such as background music, decor and crowding; the time of day or amount of time the consumer has available; timing of the purchase [e.g., last-minute]; and the consumer’s mood); psychological (e.g., motivation, personality, perception, lifestyle, attitudes and beliefs); and, socio-cultural (e.g., word of mouth and opinion leaders; reference groups such as family, friends, celebrities or athletes; culture and subcultures).

9C99EAE5C73044F68D0384AE6EF198B5.description: Reflect on personal experiences with the purchase decision process.

BF22C3CF116249D38229FD7D3C83D85C.description: Describe the five stages (i.e., problem recognition, information search, evaluation of alternatives, purchase decision and post-purchase behaviour) of the purchase decision process that a consumer goes through in making purchasing decisions.

6F8A0236F40F47D4B368278499D014B7.description: Examine the relationship among Maslow’s Hierarchy of Needs, consumer behaviour and marketing.

89D598DA65D14AE599478484BBF217AD.description: Discover how and why consumer behaviour can change over time.

942AC6A361614FBA8AF2008CF7D8A9FE.description: Discuss the importance of understanding consumer behaviour for effective and successful marketing.

CF414AFD2B3D49B3ADCD0E620A478D29.description: Analyze the relationship between consumer behaviour and marketing.

2252D42EE2A54DBBA42FD5FB8E1991C7.description: Assess the current state of demographic, socio-cultural, economic, technological and regulatory forces locally, provincially, nationally and globally for a variety of products

EC04DFD8D9A647AAA08D1194008D2667.description: Research the purpose of, and ways to conduct, an environmental scan.

010376C3A1244FEDB86A3F47EFE16F24.description: Identify examples for each of the forces such as: age, gender, ethnicity, education and marital status of the population (demographic); cultural values, ideas and beliefs; societal morals (socio-cultural); inflation; recession; interest rates; consumers’ gross, disposable and discretionary income (economic); availability and use of technology (e.g., internet access, e-commerce, smartphones, tablets, mobile payments) (technological); activity of direct and indirect competition (competitive); and, regulations or restrictions imposed on marketing practises by government and industry association (regulatory)

75EA6D1DE1D8424080A0D396042DDEE4.description: Examine forces (i.e., demographic, socio-cultural, economic, technological, competitive and regulatory) that influence the marketing environment

8DB33840262C4BFFA212F1DA67C71C9B.description: Summarize reasons (e.g., importance to business or organizational success, career opportunities and being an informed consumer) for studying marketing.

2DC8BA146BFB4B4B9CAFC7DA40D98783.description: Relate marketing to competing effectively, much like a sports team plays to its strengths.

59D932529D0D44AE8B26D0DB8E266A6F.description: Identify examples of commercial (e.g., Saskatchewan Roughriders) and social (e.g., ending mental health stigma or promoting the use of seatbelts) marketing.

3801F904F6894C82BFD9B472D9F92DFE.description: Describe the areas that marketing entails beyond selling and advertising.

A47793335C3D4957BE4865296E466615.description: Analyze the relationship between marketing and business or organizational success.
